intro: Mariscus cephalotes, commonly known as the helmeted mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive helmet-shaped inflorescence, which gives it its common name. Its leaves are typically ovate with a hairy texture, and it produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink and white. Mariscus cephalotes is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
